title: Ulta Beauty Could Trade a Bit Higher but a Quality Base Has Not Yet Developed
text:
Jim Cramer took a closer look during Thursday's Mad Money program at Ulta Beauty (ULTA) , which suffered a brutal decline, to see if there's an opportunity in the name.

When ULTA reported earnings in late August, not many investors were prepared for the 30% one-day decline that it suffered. Shares were sold in the days and weeks after the results as investors wanted to rid their portfolios of the stock.

The company missed on earnings, revenue and same-store sales. Worse, management cut its outlook for each of the three metrics as well. The insider selling from April suddenly made a bit more sense.

But Cramer noticed an interesting development after this brutal decline.

First, some of those insiders have started buying again, and unlike selling, there's only one reason to buy: Because they think the stock will go back up.

Further, the stock has begun to rebound recently, but slipped 2% on Thursday. Cramer said he believes the rebound is real and that investors who like the name should consider buying a portion of their desired allocation now and more on a deeper decline.

It's true the stock has a slower growth rate than before, but Ulta is still doing well as a retailer in this environment. However, its valuation now looks a lot more attractive than it did earlier this year, he reasoned.

In this daily bar chart of ULTA, below, we can see the sharp downside price gap (price void) and the recent partial recovery. The u-turn in prices in September does not look all that different than the reversal back in December but that is where the comparison stops in my mind.

The On-Balance-Volume (OBV) line did not turn up in September as it did in December and January.

The Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) oscillator went to a lower low from back in December so it did not show us a bullish divergence.

In this weekly bar chart of ULTA, below, we can see the sharp decline but the way this chart is constructed we do not see the price gap. Prices are holding the prior low of December but we don't have much confidence in it as this low has not been retested.

The weekly OBV line shows a quick uptick but the MACD oscillator is still very bearish.

In this Point and Figure chart of ULTA, below, we can see that the software has projected a relatively nearby price target of $274. Not all that far from current levels. That is not to say that ULTA cannot rise any further but it is saying that some technically oriented traders may not be willing to push it much higher than $274.

Bottom line strategy: Our Point and Figure chart (above) suggests that ULTA can trade higher but the rest of our charts are not constructive and the combination is going to keep us sidelined for now.
description: Let's check the latest charts and indicators of ULTA to see if it is showing improvement....ULTA
authors: Ulta Beauty Could Trade A Bit Higher But A Quality Base Has Not Yet Developed
Indicators Of Ulta To See If It Is Showing Improvement.
